page.title: 19BECKETTS' EGG PRODUCTION
page.content: At Heath Farm they have about 50,000 battery hens. Each hen lays about 5-6 eggs a week. The hens are fed on food trays called chain feeders. They have 110 grains including maize,soya and wheat. Their water comes from pipes at the back of the cages. There are five hens in each cage and they are cleaned out automatically twice a day because there are fewer diseases if the cage is clean.On the Free Range unit there were several 1000 hens.At Chapel Green Farm they have got 25000 chicks. The chicks that we saw were only 1 day old so they were very small.They are fed on food called chick mash which con- tains maize,wheat and vitamins.Water comes from hanging dishes.Becketts sent millions of dried eggs to help starving people in Ethiopia.They employ about 100 local people.{M.Green {
